newsitem.title: BAHRAIN: BMB to sign $75 mln bank loan on Sunday.
newsitem.headline: BMB to sign $75 mln bank loan on Sunday.

text.p: Bahrain Middle East Bank, an offshore investment bank, said on Thursday it would sign a $75 million syndicated loan with banks on Sunday.
Chief executive Albert Kittaneh said the three-year loan carried a margin of 7/8 points over LIBOR.
"We went for $30 million. But it had been oversubscribed three times," Kittaneh told Reuters, adding 24 international banks were taking part in the financing.
He said Arab Banking Corp, The Arab Investment Co and Chase Manhattan were lead managers.
Kittaneh said the loan would be used to finance long-term investments and to provide medium-term liquidity for the bank to balance its assets and liabilities.
Bahrain-based BMB is 28.6 percent owned by Burgan Bank BUBK.KW SAK of Kuwait. The rest is held by Gulf Arab investors.
